channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Goldsmith Road / Dove Row Defaced new traffic sign / cycle only sign, 1st August
item.description:
Defaced new traffic sign / cycle only sign - for new bus gate area Whiston Road / Dove Row

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Goldsmiths Row, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture on pavement again, 1st August
item.description:
More furniture on the pavement outside 53 Balliol Road again, been there over 3 weeks now. This is becoming a regular occurrence, a letter needs to be sent to home owners, instead of my council tax paying for free collection!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Balliol Road, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Homeless Encampment, 1st August
item.description:
Large group of rowdy threatening individuals, sleeping, cooking and living on the square. Rubbish everywhere and frequently break out into verbal and physical fights. Utterly unpleasant for anyone else to use this park as it’s unsafe and you have to move through quickly and keep your wits about you. What are the council doing about this, it’s been going on for years?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cavendish Square, Mayfair, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cardboard dumped, 1st August
item.description:
A large amount of card board boxes have been broken down along with big bags and dumped next to litter bin on Montagu Square and Upper Montagu Street

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Montagu Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin dumped in parking space - no markings, 1st August
item.description:
Overflowing bin has been dumped in parking space. There are no markings so it is a hazard if a car tries to reverse into the space as they could crash into it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bethune Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dying/dead tree, 1st August
item.description:
The tree outside my house (40 Mead Way) has brown leaves and also, some bark appears to be missing from the trunk. I think it may have died.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mead Way, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip. Garden waste and cardboard tubes, 1st August
item.description:
New neighbour at number 18 Sudbury crescent dumped it today. Told him he can't put it there. Also there is a notice saying no flytipping. He said so what. Probably dump the rest in his front garden when it's dark

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sudbury Crescent, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter, 1st August
item.description:
No cleaning of streets for two weeks or more, recycle around today and road full of litter, aren't the streets automatically cleaned after rubbish/recycle collection? Always really bad near where I live.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blandford Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary traffic signals all out, 1st August
item.description:
Multiple reports that the temporary traffic signals are all out
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Palace Gates Road, Hornsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tip, 1st August
item.description:
Freezer dumped. Main road Orpington opposite Homebase entrance. I reported this earlier and received a reply to say that your contractors could not find it. How can they miss a 4 foot chest freezer. It's still there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large shrubs overhang footpath, 1st August
item.description:
The shrubs along Woodside Avenue are long over due for cutting back. Please can they all be done along the road and around the base of trees.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodside Avenue, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car with expired MOT dumped on public road, 1st August
item.description:
As photographed on 1st August a scruffy car with no valid MOT is dumped on a public road Wrottesley Road. It’s been here for a few weeks now. I’m reporting because this road is notorious for unused dumped cars dumped here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wrottesley Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 1st August
item.description:
Bag on railings

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bishop's Bridge Road, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large fly tip of bed bases and a shopping trolley full of rubbish., 1st August
item.description:
A large amount of fly tipping on the corner of Worsley Bridge Road and Meadowview Road. Bed bases and a shopping trolley full of rubbish has been dumped on the grass verge, looks awful and will encourage more fly tipping. Please can this be removed asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadowview Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned tent, 1st August
item.description:
A blue tent has been abandoned and left on Granville Place opposite the M&S loading bay along with a pallet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19-25, Granville Place, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Clay and sand in the road, 1st August
item.description:
After dealing with a leak on the footpath, Thames water have left a large pile of clay and sand in the road which is very slippery and unsightly. It is blocking road use and may be a danger to pedestrians if they slip on it. Thames water have sent someone out to look but say they cannot clear it up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, East Woodside, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wayside Grove, Elmstead, London

item.title: Mattress x4, 1st August
item.description:
Mattress left outside house that is currently not being occupied I believe that they have been left today There are about 4 I am worried that they may have bedbugs
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downderry Road, Downham, London
